short_details_chef: Chef Martin Yan, Passionate chef specializing in Mediterranean cuisine with 15 years of experience. Known for his flavorful dishes and attention to detail.

making_process: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or wok over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sliced onion. Stir-fry for a few minutes until fragrant.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.

Add the bell peppers, potatoes, carrot, dried chili peppers, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, chili paste, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Stir well to coat the chicken and vegetables with the sauce.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve the Da Pan Ji hot with steamed rice or noodles.
Enjoy the flavorful and spicy Big Plate Chicken!

Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve the Da Pan Ji hot with steamed rice or noodles.
Enjoy the flavorful and spicy Big Plate Chicken!
